pull.title: doc: Refer in rpcbind doc to the manpage
pull.body:
The help was outdated, so refer to the updated manpage instead.


* closes #14740
* closes #9272

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14740](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14740.html) (docs: Update rpcbind doc to match the manpage by sp4ke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

ACK fa0119af226255ce1e0e573a575ab37539ff8693

> Concept ACK fa0119a

I don't understand, why would you concept ACK a one-line documentation change instead of just ACKing?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -70,8 +70,8 @@
 # server=1 tells Bitcoin-Qt and bitcoind to accept JSON-RPC commands
 #server=0
 
-# Bind to given address to listen for JSON-RPC connections. Use [host]:port notation for IPv6.
-# This option can be specified multiple times (default: bind to all interfaces)
+# Bind to given address to listen for JSON-RPC connections.
+# Refer to the manpage or bitcoind -help for further details.
comments.body: This is true for all options, really, I've sometimes wondered if we shouldn't generate the example configuration somehow  (do people prefer this inline style to manpages?) instead of having a separate place with options documentation here.
